importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of Colombia recalling its ambassador to the U.S., marking a significant escalation in diplomatic tensions between Colombia and the United States.
Prior recall of the Colombian ambassador in July following a reciprocal action by the U.S. government, indicating a recurring diplomatic strain between the two nations.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period immediately following the U.S. missile attacks on suspected drug-smuggling vessels and the subsequent diplomatic actions, including Colombia's recall of its ambassador and U.S. threats to raise tariffs.

keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, citing U.S. actions related to drug trafficking and alleged attacks on Colombian vessels.
This is the second time this year that Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington, following a prior recall in July after U.S. actions against Colombian officials.
U.S. President Donald Trump accused President Gustavo Petro of being a 'drug leader' and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods, exacerbating tensions.

The U.S. has deployed warships in the Caribbean and launched missile attacks on seven vessels allegedly involved in drug trafficking, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including some reportedly Colombian citizens.

Colombia accused the United States of 'murder' after claiming some individuals on board attacked vessels were Colombian nationals, and a Colombian citizen was later returned safely from one of the vessels.
The diplomatic spat reflects broader issues of drug policy, sovereignty, and economic relations between Colombia and the U.S.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, amid escalating tensions over U.S. military operations targeting suspected drug-smuggling vessels in the Caribbean. The move follows a prior diplomatic incident in July, when the U.S. summoned its ambassador in Bogotá, and comes after President Donald Trump accused Colombian President Gustavo Petro of being a 'drug leader' and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods. The U.S. has launched missile attacks on seven vessels, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Colombia claiming some were Colombian citizens and accusing the U.S. of 'murder.' A Colombian citizen was later returned safely from one of the vessels, further deepening the diplomatic rift. This crisis reflects broader tensions over drug policy, sovereignty, and economic relations between Colombia and the United States.
title: Colombian ambassador to US recalled to Bogotá for consultations, embassy says
